bibl.title: Letter from [s.n.] Rovensky to Ralph Cooper Hutchison, February 3, 1937

div1.p: Rovensky informs Hutchison that he met with Lord Dawson to encourage him to visit the United States to lecture at Washington and Jefferson College.

div1.head: Letter from [s.n.] Rovensky to Ralph Cooper Hutchison, February 3, 1937

opener.dateline:
Eighteen Pine Street
New York
London, February 3rd, 1937

div1.p:
Through the kindness of our office an appoint-
ment was arranged for me to meet Lord Dawson of Penn this
morning at 9:30. I called at his home at 32 Wimpole Street,
W.1. He received me in his study and we got along
beautifully. He is a very lovely man. I presented your
letter to him and we had a chat for over half an hour.
He was as gracious as he could be and he made it very plain
that he was deeply appreciative of your courtesy. He came
to the door with me when I left. The following are the
facts.

Lord Dawson is the President of the Royal Col-
lege of Physicians which position he has held since 1931.
He will likely be re-elected. October is an important
month in the school's activities and he is wondering how
his colleagues at the school would feel if he were absent
at that time. In a nice way he showed me how strongly
they followed old traditions as the school goes back to its
original charter which was granted by Henry VIII. He did
not promise that he would go, but said he would give it
his consideration and let you know. My bet would be that
he will go as he has not been in the States since 1929.
There is no question but what he would make a wonderful
impression, and that he would give a good talk, as I have
ascertained here that he is a good speaker, and it would be
a great event to get him to come to America for the purpose
of coming to W. & J. I promised to do anything for him
that he might wish when he came to New York. Let us hope
that we will be successful.
div1.closer:
Sincerely, Rovensky.
P.S. Attached is an extract from the British Who's Who
on Lord Dawson.
Mr. R. C. Hutchinson
Washington and Jefferson College
Washington, Pennsylvania
